drug_database.name: Atorvastatin
drug_database.diet: Low-fat, high-fiber, avoid grapefruit juice.

drug_database.name: Levothyroxine
drug_database.diet: Avoid soy, walnuts, and high-fiber foods within 4 hours.

drug_database.name: Lisinopril
drug_database.diet: Low sodium (DASH diet), avoid potassium-rich salt substitutes.

drug_database.name: Metformin
drug_database.diet: Complex carbs only, high fiber, limit sugary fruits.

drug_database.name: Amlodipine
drug_database.diet: Low salt, limit caffeine.

drug_database.name: Metoprolol
drug_database.diet: Low sodium, limit alcohol.

drug_database.name: Albuterol
drug_database.diet: Avoid dairy if phlegm is an issue, stay hydrated.
drug_database.home_remedies: Steam inhalation, Ginger tea for inflammation.

drug_database.name: Omeprazole
drug_database.diet: Smaller meals, avoid spicy/acidic foods, no late-night snacks.
drug_database.home_remedies: Raising head of bed, Aloevera juice (Consult doctor).

drug_database.name: Losartan
drug_database.diet: Low sodium, avoid potassium supplements.

drug_database.name: Sertraline
drug_database.diet: Limit alcohol and caffeine.
drug_database.home_remedies: Daily sunlight, regular exercise, Fish oils (Consult doctor).

drug_database.name: Gabapentin
drug_database.diet: Stay hydrated, limit alcohol.

drug_database.name: Amoxicillin
drug_database.diet: Probiotic-rich (curd/yogurt) to restore gut flora.
drug_database.home_remedies: Warm salt water gargles for throat, Vitamin C.

drug_database.name: Azithromycin
drug_database.diet: Light meals, avoid heavy oily food during infection.

drug_database.name: Ibuprofen
drug_database.diet: Always take with food/milk.

drug_database.name: Acetaminophen
drug_database.diet: Avoid alcohol completely while taking.

drug_database.name: Paracetamol
drug_database.diet: Stay hydrated, avoid alcohol.
drug_database.home_remedies: Rest, cool damp cloth on forehead.

drug_database.name: Amylmetacresol + Dextrometacresol
drug_database.diet: Warm fluids only, no cold water/ice cream.

drug_database.name: Dichlorobenzyl Alcohol
drug_database.diet: Warm herbal teas, avoid spice.

drug_database.name: Nimesulide + Paracetamol
drug_database.diet: Take with light snacks or milk, stay hydrated.

drug_database.name: Omeprazole + Paracetamol
drug_database.restrictions: Take before meals for best effect
drug_database.diet: Avoid carbonated drinks, small frequent meals.

drug_database.name: Vapor Rub
drug_database.diet: Hot soups, avoid dairy if mucus is thick.

drug_database.name: DPP-4 Inhibitors (Sitagliptin/Vildagliptin)
drug_database.diet: Consistent carb intake, focus on pulses and green veg.

drug_database.name: Aspirin
drug_database.diet: Avoid excessive garlic or ginger supplements (blood thinning).

drug_database.name: Aluminum Hydroxide
drug_database.diet: Limit citric acid (orange juice), take 1 hour after meals.
drug_database.home_remedies: Cold milk, smaller meals, avoid sleeping immediately after eating.

drug_database.name: Tincture Belladonna
drug_database.diet: High fiber to avoid constipation (side effect).
drug_database.home_remedies: Sucking on sugar-free ice chips for dry mouth.

visual_patterns.m_vs_n: Contextualize based on following vowel; 'm' usually has 3 humps, 'n' has 2.
visual_patterns.l_vs_i: 'l' is taller, 'i' often has a detached dot or is just a shorter vertical stroke.
visual_patterns.o_vs_a: 'a' has a vertical tail, 'o' is a closed loop often with a connecting top whisk.
visual_patterns.t_vs_plus: Horizontal crossbar position determines if it's a letter or a math symbol.
visual_patterns.r_vs_v: Check the sharp bottom versus the rounded stroke.

slurred_cursive.C_as_O: Doctors often start 'C' with a loop that looks like an 'O'. If dosage is lozenge, it is likely 'Cofsils'.
slurred_cursive.f_as_ squiggle: The letter 'f' in the middle of a word is often just a tall vertical spike with a tiny crossbar.
slurred_cursive.s_as_wave: The trailing 's' is often a flat horizontal line or a tiny wave.
slurred_cursive.D_as_B: Caps 'D' in 'Dolo' can look like a 'B' if the doctor loops the top. Look for '650' to confirm 'Dolo'.

handwriting_logic.pharmacist_elimination: 1. Extract raw letters (e.g., 'C...f...s'). 2. Match pattern 'C*f*s*' against brand names. 3. Cross-reference usage (Cough) and form (Lozenges) to confirm 'Cofsils'.
